messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Sotheby auction
messages.msgSnippet: Hi. The number notations, curiously enough, include tsuba and their signed boxes if any. The irony was that things with a Compton name tended to do well,
messages.messageBody:
Hi.
The number notations, curiously enough, include tsuba and their signed
boxes if any. The irony was that things with a "Compton" name tended to
do well, where as it is the "Harvie" name that ought to have been the
clue to value after value.
Arnold



>>> swords@... 07/16/05 12:16 PM >>>
Hi all -

Not having the catalogue for Alan Harvie's tsuba (Sotheby's auction just
ended), I'm curious if lot 706 was a single tsuba or was that for
multiple tsuba. It appears to be a single, ex-Compton Kamakura-bori
tsuba but further down (on the internet listing) it mentions "quantity
2" which puzzles me. Pretty healthy price for a tsuba, if indeed one
tsuba. If so, would you say "provenance" played a big roll in achieving
this price?

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Sotheby auction
messages.msgSnippet: Actually the prices on the results sheet include the 20% buyer s premium, so this was even more of a bargain at $7,989! The catalog is a great reference, and
messages.messageBody:
Actually the prices on the results sheet include the 20% buyer's
premium, so this was even more of a 'bargain' at $7,989!

The catalog is a great reference, and I'll have it in stock in a
couple of weeks, and will have copies for sale at the San Francisco
Token Kai.

--
Craig Harris
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com

On 7/16/05, David Zincavage <jdz@...> wrote:
> The two in parenthesis does mean there are two items: the tsuba and the the tsuba box bearing a hakogaki by Torigoye.
>
> The 4560 pounds + 20 % buyer's premium of 912 = 5472 x 1.752 conversion rate to dollars = 8760 more or less, but probably a little more. But it is a famous piece, one we all recognize from the book.
>
> DZ

messages.subject: Re: Sotheby auction
messages.msgSnippet: The two in parenthesis does mean there are two items: the tsuba and the the tsuba box bearing a hakogaki by Torigoye. The 4560 pounds + 20 % buyer s premium of
messages.messageBody:
The two in parenthesis does mean there are two items: the tsuba and the the tsuba box bearing a hakogaki by Torigoye.

The 4560 pounds + 20 % buyer's premium of 912 = 5472 x 1.752 conversion rate to dollars = 8760 more or less, but probably a little more. But it is a famous piece, one we all recognize from the book.

DZ
